intro: Drepanophyllum falcaria, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with dense, leathery foliage. The plant produces small, white, bell-shaped flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are elliptical and have a distinctive waxy texture, while its bark is smooth and grayish in color. Drepanophyllum falcaria is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
